item.name: Adventurer's Ring
entries: While the cover on this ring is open, the ring produces a flame that creates no heat and consumes no fuel. It sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 20-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 20 feet. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can close the cover, smothering the flame, or open it again.

item.name: Axe Beak
entries: Use the {@creature Axe Beak|XMM} stat block.

item.name: Bright Fungal Cloak
entries: While wearing a Bright Fungal Cloak, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to furl or unfurl it. When the cloak is unfurled, it sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 5-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 5 feet.
One pound of fungus is sewn into a Bright Fungal Cloak. This fungus can be eaten as food. Once all the fungus is consumed, the cloak becomes a mundane set of {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}.

item.name: Covered Wagon
entries: This vehicle is a {@item Wagon|XPHB} covered by durable canvas. A creature has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover} while riding inside this vehicle.

entries.caption: Cult of the Dragon Trinkets
rows: A dragon claw pendant on a leather cord
Ashes of a dracolich in a small brass canister
A map of an unknown dragon's lair
A black pearl etched with a Draconic rune
A drop of dragon's blood preserved in amber
A scrap of purple silk

item.name: Desert Clothing
entries: When you are wearing Desert Clothing and not wearing Medium or Heavy armor, you automatically succeed on saving throws against the effects of {@hazard extreme heat|XDMG}.

item.name: Devil Mask
entries: While you are wearing a Devil Mask, other creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to discern your true identity or intentions.

entries.caption: Emerald Enclave Trinkets
rows: A pair of earrings made from oak leaves that never wilt
A miniature model cottage made of twigs
A green-glowing firefly in a bottle
A gourd that sounds like rustling leaves when held to one's ear
A preserved rabbit's foot on a leather strap
An antler shaped like an Elvish rune

item.name: Flying Snake
entries: Pet flying snakes use the {@creature Flying Snake|XMM} stat block.

item.name: Garb of Light and Shadow
entries: This garb appeals to Fey from one Domain of Delight, such as the Gloaming Court or the Summer Court. While wearing the garb, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks to influence Fey associated with that Domain of Delight.

item.name: Genie Robe
entries: This robe appeals to Elementals associated with a particular Elemental Plane (Air, Earth, Fire, Water). While wearing a Genie Robe, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made to influence Elementals associated with that plane.

entries.caption: Harper Trinkets
rows: A broken harmonica
A powder compact with a hidden compartment
A 2-foot-long peacock feather
A trick coin that's heads on both sides
A pair of red-tinted spectacles
A scroll of sheet music for an unknown instrument

item.name: Locking Spellbook
entries: This 100-page leather-bound tome can be used as a Spellbook. It is closed with a lock that comes with a key. As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, a creature can try to pick the lock using {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, doing so with a successful DC 15 Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}) check.

entries.caption: Lords' Alliance Trinkets
rows: A scrap from a defeated army's banner
A bit and bridle engraved with the name of a famous steed
The broken blade of a sword used in a famous battle
The left glove of a lord who went mysteriously missing
An articulated toy horse and knight
A spaulder emblazoned with the insignia of an unidentified lord

item.name: Monster Camouflage
entries: A suit of Monster Camouflage looks like a Beast or Monstrosity, such as an {@creature owlbear|XMM}. To discern that you're disguised, a creature must take the {@action Study|XPHB} action to inspect your appearance and succeed on a DC 10 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB} or {@skill Nature|XPHB}) check. The creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on this check if it is within 30 feet of you and automatically succeeds on this check if you do anything the monster you're disguised as couldn't do.

entries.caption: Order of the Gauntlet Trinkets
rows: A white feather as heavy as lead
An empty vial made from stained glass
A single cone of gold-flecked incense
A silken blindfold
One half of a pair of manacles
A tarnished aspergillum

entries.caption: Purple Dragon Knight Trinkets
rows: An amethyst dragon wyrmling's claw
A common purple quartz cut to resemble a dragon's eye
A signal whistle audible only to amethyst dragons
A robin's egg encased in amber
A whetstone that leaves any blade it hones faintly glittery
A vamplate taken from a slain rival jouster

entries.caption: Red Wizard Trinkets
rows: A gnarled wand made from petrified yew
A glass jar containing the preserved heart of an unknown animal
A unicorn figurine carved from obsidian
A tattoo needle made from one of your own bones
A bronze amulet in the shape of a scorpion
A razor made of crimson steel

item.name: Sled Dog
entries: A sled dog uses the {@creature Wolf|XMM} stat block (see the Monster Manual). A sled dog pulling a sled alone must take a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} after pulling a sled for 1 hour; otherwise, it gains 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level.

item.name: Thayan Spell Tattoo
entries: This magical tattoo contains the essence of a level 1-3 spell chosen by the tattoo's creator. While the tattoo is on your body, you always have the associated spell prepared, and you can cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature, the spell uses your spellcasting ability; otherwise, if the spell requires a saving throw or an attack roll, the spell save DC is 13 and the attack bonus is +5. If your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes.
You can also cast the spell once without a spell slot and spell components. Once the spell is cast in this way, the tattoo vanishes.

entries.name: Inking Thayan Spell Tattoos
entries: The Thayan art of magical tattooing is highly guarded by its practitioners, and thus, Thayan Spell Tattoos can't be crafted like other magic items. To learn how to ink Thayan Spell Tattoos, you must have a Renown Score of 50+ with the Red Wizards.

To ink a Thayan Spell Tattoo, you must have proficiency in the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} skill and with {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} and have the spell prepared each day of the inking. You must also have at hand any Material components required by the spell; if the spell consumes its Material components, they are consumed when you complete the tattoo. Inking a Thayan Spell Tattoo takes the same amount of {@book time and money|XDMG|6|Time and Cost} as scribing a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG} of an equivalent level.

item.name: Warm Fungal Clothing
entries: When you're wearing Warm Fungal Clothing, you automatically succeed on saving throws against the effects of extreme cold. See chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for rules on extreme cold. One pound of fungus is sewn into Fungal Clothing. This fungus can be eaten as food. Once all the fungus is consumed, this becomes a mundane set of {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}.

item.name: Winter Camouflage
entries: While you wear Winter Camouflage in an appropriate environment, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks.

entries.caption: Zhentarim Trinkets
rows: A broken dagger etched with your name
A glass eye that always turns to face you
A gold-colored serpent's tooth
A counterfeit gold coin
A crystal tattoo needle
A contract on a slip of parchment that's impervious to creases, tears, and fire
